column3:
I've look through `./configure --help` and not sure if these options:
`-no-egl`
`-no-libudev`
`-no-openvg`
`-optimized-qmake`
are acceptable by Qt 5.9.7 `configure`.

Some thoughts about disabled Qt features.
1. Qt build does not include [`QtPrintSupport`](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5.9/qtprintsupport-module.html) module; therefore, it is redundant to mention:
```
$(package)_config_opts += -no-feature-printer
$(package)_config_opts += -no-feature-printdialog
```

2. Qt build does not include [`QtConcurrent`](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5.9/qtconcurrent-module.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#14066](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/14066.html) (gitian-linux: Build binaries for 64-bit POW

@hebasto Thanks for your thoughts:

> $(package)_config_opts += -no-feature-printer
$(package)_config_opts += -no-feature-printdialog

These were specifically introduced to [fix the depends build on macOS](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9574). I'd rather leave them in place for now. Similar thoughts for `-no-egl -no-libudev -no-openvg -optimized-qmake`. Maybe once we move to Qt
@fanquake You are right. Qt docs confused me a little :)\nutACK 311498de728bd584d51865aa62e06091235baab5
Successful gitian build: https://bitcoin.jonasschnelli.ch/build/907 Tested on OSX:

Passing `-no-feature-sql` disables the Qt sql module in its entirety, see the output in the configure summary:
```
Qt modules and options:
  Qt Network ............................. yes
  Qt Sql ................................. no
  Qt Testlib ............................. yes
```
